headline: Why Shares of QuantumScape, First Solar, and ChargePoint Plunged in October
summary: After a bullish September when markets raced higher, investor sentiment headed south in October, resulting in the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) and Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJINDICES: ^DJI) tumbling 1% and 1.3%, respectively.  Several alternative energy stocks, however, suffered even steeper declines.  According to data provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence, First Solar (NASDAQ: FSLR), a leading manufacturer of solar panels, plunged 22%, while solid state battery specialist QuantumScape (NYSE: QS) and ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT), a leader in electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure, dropped 10.4% and 12.4%, respectively.

headline: Solar, Clean Energy Stocks Hammered After Trump’s White House Victory
summary: Solar and clean energy stocks sold off heavily on Wednesday after Donald Trump defeated Kamala Harris to clinch leadership of the White House.
